newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's De Longhi seeks bourse listing by 2000.
newsitem.headline: Italy's De Longhi seeks bourse listing by 2000.

text.p: Italy's De Longhi group, a well-known maker of air conditioning equipment, is looking to be quoted on the Milan stock market by the year 2000.
"We want to be quoted to grow on a world level. We have the ideas and development possibilities," chairman Giuseppe De Longhi told reporters at the presentation of a new ecological air conditioner.
The company, currently controlled by a series of Luxembourg holdings, had 1996 turnover of 1.40 trillion lire of which 65 percent came from exports.
Profit in 1996 was in line with that of 1995, De Longhi said without giving figures.

The group has nine plants in northern Italy but is also looking to manufacture abroad. Brazil is "a very good market where we are seeking to set up a joint venture to manufacture there," De Longhi said. Other areas of interest were the United States and Croatia.
